title: Web Application Basics: HTTP and Targeted Ports
excerpt: Covers fundamental HTTP Request Methods (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, OPTIONS) and common network ports (443, 3389, 5650) targeted by attackers during a hack.

full_content.heading: HTTP Request Methods
full_content.intro: These methods define the intended action for a given resource on a web server:
points: GET: Retrieves data from a server without modifying it.
POST: Sends data to the server to create or update a resource.
PUT: Updates or replaces an existing resource on the server.
HEAD: Retrieves only the headers from a resource, not the actual content.
OPTIONS: Displays the supported HTTP methods and communication options for a target resource.

full_content.heading: Common Ports Targeted During a Hack
full_content.intro: Attackers frequently target these network ports due to their function:
points: 443 (HTTPS): Secure web traffic; often targeted for encrypted attacks or data interception.
3389 (RDP - Remote Desktop Protocol): Used for remote access; a frequent target for brute-force attacks.
5650: Sometimes exploited by attackers for unauthorized connections or backdoor access.
